thread.title: AD: Peugeot Trade In & Trade Up – enjoy the highest trade-in value for your old car to get a new Peugeot
thread.title_full: AD: Peugeot Trade In & Trade Up – enjoy the highest trade-in value for your old car to get a new Peugeot

author: Harvinder Sidhu
title: AD: Peugeot Trade In & Trade Up – enjoy the highest trade-in value for your old car to get a new Peugeot
text:
Car Market Value Guide Home » Special Coverage » Advertorial » AD: Peugeot Trade In & Trade Up – enjoy the highest trade-in value for your old car to get a new Peugeot AD: Peugeot Trade In & Trade Up – enjoy the highest trade-in value for your old car to get a new Peugeot 23 March 2017 2:45 pm / Comments are Disabled 
Trading in your current vehicle isn’t as simple as it sounds nowadays – there are plenty of hurdles to jump though, and the prices offered may not be up to your expectations. That’s where the Peugeot Trade In & Trade Up campaign comes in. 
If you’re looking to get a new ride, do come over to Peugeot showrooms to get the highest trade in value for your current car, making that brand new Peugeot vehicle that much more affordable. Offer is valid while stocks last, so now’s the time to pounce. Out with the old, save on the new! 
There certainly won’t be better time to trade in your car for a brand new Peugeot 308 THP, the 508 (including the sedan, SW and the 508 GT diesel) and the 5008 MPV. The high trade in values are not to be missed. 
Peugeot’s latest range, including the new 208 and 2008 SUV PureTech, as well as the new 208 GTi hot hatch will be on display as well. Come one and come all – great deals are to be had on all new Peugeot models. 
Interested? Do click here for more information . Harvinder Singh Sidhu thinks there's nothing better than Formula 1, not even sliced bread. Having written about cars since 2006, he plunged head first into the industry out of a passion for all things four-wheeled and everything in between. The F1 enthusiast has been following the sport since 1999 and has been keeping up with it since. In between races he keeps himself busy as the host of the Driven motoring TV programme and as our version of the Joker.
